title: Problem 2123_E
statement: Define the \mathrm{MEX} (minimum excluded value) of an array to be the smallest nonnegative integer not present in the array. For example, \mathrm{MEX}([2, 2, 1]) = 0 because 0 is not in the array. \mathrm{MEX}([3, 1, 0, 1]) = 2 because 0 and 1 are in the array but 2 is not. \mathrm{MEX}([0, 3, 1, 2]) = 4 because 0, 1, 2, and 3 are in the array but 4 is not. You are given an array a of size n of nonnegative integers.For all k (0≤q k ≤q n), count the number of possible values of \mathrm{MEX}(a) a
